News and Blog

  • 01 August 2018

    RADWAN will be presented at SIGCOMM 2018! Congrats to Rachee, Phillipa and collaborators!

  • 01 August 2018

    2 papers from our group accepted at IMC 2018! More details coming soon! Congrats to Rachee, Abbas, Phillipa and collaborators!

  • 29 July 2018

    Paper on Tor bridge blocking got accepted to FOCI 2018! Congrats to Arun and Phillipa!

  • 22 May 2018

    Abbas’ work on privacy and tracking in mobile is featured by Stony Brook Computer Science. Click here to read more.

  • 08 April 2018

    Congrats to Rachee on receiving a Google PhD Fellowship! Read more about it here

  • 08 February 2018

    Our paper on studying advertising and tracking on Android using Lumen is published at NDSS! Congrats to Abbas and Rishab!

  • 07 September 2017

    Our papers on studying TLS usage in Android using Lumen, and localizing Internet censorship using path churn have been accepted to CoNEXT! Congrats to Abbas, Arian, Rishab, and Shinyong!

    Congratulations to Phillipa for her inclusion in MIT Technology Review’s 35 Innovators Under 35 list!

    Our paper on Castle is accepted to EuroS&P and Astoria is accepted to NDSS! Congrats to Rishab, Bridger and Oleksii on these successful submissions!

    Our Large grant on censorship got funded! Looking forward to good collaborations in the years ahead. Thanks NSF!

    Camera readies for our two IMC papers and forthcoming PETS paper can be found on the publications page.

    Phillipa will be serving on the program committee for SIGCOMM ‘16.

    Phillipa will be co-chairing IMC 2016 to be held in sunny Los Angeles with John Heidemann of ISI/USC.

  • 30 July 2015

    Our group will have two papers appearing at the Internet Measurement Conference in Japan! Congrats to Arash, Adrian, Abbas, Kevin and Rajesh for their work on traffic differentiation testing and Ruwaifa and Haseeb for their work on measuring routing policies!

    The Networking Research Group hosted the ICLab/Google Workshop on Network Inference at the CEWIT center.

    Phillipa will be participating in the Hebrew University Networking Summer event at Hebrew U from June 1-14.

  • 30 April 2015

    Wired magazine covers our video game-based covert channel mechanism! (Wired article, Technical article)

  • 30 April 2015

    Phillipa gave a talk about ICLab at CAIDA’s AIMS workshop, and presented our work on politically motivated adversaries at Berkeley’s TRUST Seminar series.

  • 30 March 2015

    Want to know if your mobile ISP is shaping specific application traffic? Try our Traffic Differentiation Detector tool!

  • 25 February 2015

    Our research on Internet traffic interceptions will be funded by a Comcast Tech Fund award. Thanks Comcast!

  • 30 January 2015

    Phillipa will serving on the program committees for: ACM CoNEXT ‘15, ACNS ‘15, Usenix ATC '15, and ACM IMC '15. Phillipa will be also co-chairing the Usenix Workshop on Free and Open Communication on the Internet (FOCI).
